snippet: LONDON - The European Court of Human Rights ruled on Tuesday that Britain could extradite five suspects wanted in the United States on terrorism charges, including Abu Hamza al-Masri, an inflammatory former cleric accused in plots dating back 14...
abstract: LONDON - The European Court of Human Rights ruled on Tuesday that Britain could extradite five suspects wanted in the United States on terrorism charges, including Abu Hamza al-Masri, an inflammatory former cleric accused in plots dating back 14 years. It is a precedent that eases extradition of terrorism suspects - an issue that has surfaced repeatedly since Britain relaxed procedures after Sept. 11. Read ALAN COWELL and JOHN F. BURNS's article »

headline.main: European Court Says Britain May Send Terror Suspects to U.S.
